questions.question: What kind of …………………… is it?
questions.description: When a common noun is used in its widest sense, it is used without an article.

questions.question: …………………….. is mortal.
questions.description: When a common noun is used in its widest sense, it is used without an article.

questions.question: ………………………. grows in many parts of India.
questions.description: Articles are omitted before material nouns.

questions.question: ……………………… is a useful metal.
questions.description: Articles are omitted before material nouns.

questions.question: He was ………………………….. of his age.
questions.description: Sometimes an article is used with proper nouns when they are used as common nouns.

questions.question: Mumbai is ……………………….. of India.
questions.description: Sometimes an article is used with proper nouns when they are used as common nouns.

questions.question: ……………………… is its own reward.
questions.description: Articles are usually omitted before abstract nouns.

questions.question: He is fluent in ……………………..
questions.description: Articles are omitted before the names of languages.

questions.question: My friend is still in ……………………….
questions.description: Articles are omitted before nouns like hospital and school when the reference is to the primary purpose of these places.

questions.question: I went to ……………………….. to see my friend.
questions.description: Articles are used before the nouns hospital and school when we are talking about these places as a building or structure.

questions.question: …………………….. has returned.
questions.description: Articles are omitted before names of relations.

questions.question: I met him at ……………………….
questions.description: Here the club is merely a meeting place and hence an article is used with that.
